column1: Thus Horn came into his kingdom again; but he had yet to punish Fikenhild the traitor
column2: who first separated him from Rimenhild (for this Aylmer had told him)
column4: who had sought to wed her against her will.Fikenhild
column5: when Horn came back to Westerness in time to save Rimenhild from Modi
column6: had fled; but he still plotted deep treachery in his heart. By bribes and favours he won many knights to follow him; and he built himself a great castle of stone
column8: surrounded on all sides with water
column9: so that none could come at it easily. Then by stealth one night he and Rimenhild carried off and married in this castle
column10: holding a great feast at sunrise to celebrate the marriage.Horn knew nought of this by word of mouth or letter. But in a dream he beheld Rimenhild: she seemed to him as though shipwrecked
column11: calling upon his name; but when she tried to swim to him
